book_topic: Applying Carl Jung's psychological concepts to modern workplace dynamics, including leadership styles, team dynamics, power structures, and personal development in professional settings
book_title: Working Minds: Applying Jungian Psychology to Leadership, Teams, and Power
author_bio: Dr. Elena Vasquez is a clinical psychologist and organizational consultant with over 15 years of experience helping leaders and teams navigate complex workplace challenges through the lens of Jungian psychology. She holds a PhD in Psychology from the University of Zurich and has worked with Fortune 500 companies worldwide.
author_voice_style: Insightful and accessible, blending academic rigor with practical workplace examples, warm and encouraging tone that empowers readers to apply concepts personally
target_audience: Business leaders, managers, HR professionals, consultants, and anyone interested in applying psychological insights to improve workplace relationships, leadership effectiveness, and team performance
book_purpose: To equip readers with Jungian psychological tools and frameworks for understanding themselves and others in professional contexts, fostering better leadership, more cohesive teams, and healthier power dynamics in organizations
